ARTICLE.TITLE: I want my 'Trumpy back' says woman of stolen life-size plastic Trump in Lafayette
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Kyle Morel

New Jersey Herald

LAFAYETTE — A township resident asked the community for help to track down her Donald Trump — a life-size image of the president stolen from her front yard last weekend.

Patricia Heaney said the 6-foot corrugated plastic likeness of Trump, outfitted in a suit and holding two thumbs up, disappeared from her property across from Abbey Glen Pet Memorial Park on Route 94 Sunday afternoon. The figure was fastened to the fence with bungee cords when stolen. Pro-Trump flags and yard signs on the lawn were left behind.

Heaney said she saw the figure from the front window around 2 p.m., but it was gone about two hours later when she looked again.

Heaney wants the figure back.

“I want my Trumpy back,” Heaney said. “No questions asked. Just drop it off in the driveway and leave it there.”

KELLY:Why won't America safeguard the upcoming presidential election?

MORE:Pro-Trump ralliers call on 'silent majority' to support police, military, president

Heaney said the thinks a Trump supporter stole the figure she bought last month for $60 to show it off. She said, the presidential items in her yard often cause motorists along the busy road to honk their horns or wave in approval.

Heaney reasoned that anyone who is against the president would have found other ways to express their opinion of the display.

“If somebody wanted to do something malicious, they would have thrown something at it,” she said, before adding with a laugh, “Maybe they would have shot it.”

Heaney said she filed a report with the State Police, which could not immediately be reached for an update.

“I don’t want anybody to get in trouble. I just want my Trump back,” Heaney said.

Kyle Morel can also be contacted on Twitter: @KMorelNJH, on Facebook: Facebook.com/KMorelNJH, or by phone: 973-383-1292.
